front.reference: IJCSNS International Journal of Computer Science and Network Security, VOL.10 No.9, September 2010
front.note:

docTitle.titlePart:
A Study on the MOST150/Ethernet Gateway of In-Vehicle
Network

byline.docAuthor:
Jong-Wook Jang
, Chang-Young Kim
, Yun-Sik Yu

byline.affiliation: Department of Computer Engineering Dong-Eui University,
Convergence of IT Devices Institute Busan,
Department of Radiological Science Dong-Eui University,

front.div:
Summary
As demands increase for the Infotainment System, the
Multimedia Networking technology for automobile, called
MOST(Media Oriented Systems Transport), has been actively
applied to the automobile industry, to meet the demands of the
Infotainment System. The MOST25 network technology is being
restrictively equipped with some of the car models but the
problems with bandwidth and compatibility has arisen. In order
to solve this, the MOST150 technology has been developed and
further research is being carried out to apply the technology to
the automobile industry. Thus, for the effective process of the
Ethernet traffic in the realization of MOST150/Ethernet Gateway
for automobile, we, in the research, shall analyse the QoS
Management Mapping method, including the MOST150's
Isochronous channel, the MOST Ethernet Packet Channel, and
etc. and study the efficient algorithm.
front.keyword:
Key words:
Vehicle Network, MOST , Gateway, QoS Algorithms, Ethernet,
IntServ, DiffServ, OPNET
